repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This is an account of the life (carittiram) of Jesuit missionary, martyr and Saint João de Brito (1647-1693), also known by his Tamil name Aruḷāṉanta Cuvāmi. The story is told by one of Brito's disciples, and a witness of his martyrdom, called Aruḷāṉantaṉ.
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

filiation.p: This manuscript is the only copy of the text currently available to us, even though in his catalogue, Julien Vinson (BnF Indien 577, folio 107r) mentions that the text has been printed by the Mission Press in Pondicherry in 1858.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil foliation 1-44, likely by the original scribe, in the left margin.

collation.desc: the front cover. ― The front cover had a sticker of the BnF with the current shelfmark (Indien 469). The back cover has on the inside some numbers in white chalk: 53bis 45 28.

44 folios = Vētacāṭciyāṉa Rācariṣi Aruḷāṉantacuvāmi Carittiram. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-14, [15], 16-33. Christian cross used as foliation 1. 450 x 25/30 mm. f15, truncated, is smaller (435 x 30 mm). f44v blank. ― The manuscript is fairly simple and is constituted by only one unit containing the text.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, despite some boreholes.

handNote.desc: Hand #1. This scribe copied f1-f10v with the sole exception of the last line (l. 5) of f10v.
Hand #2. This scribe copied the last line of f10v, and f11-f44v. The letters have sharper angles and the writing is inclined towards the right.

additions.desc: Shelfmark: N° 9 (f1r). This is the number in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue, first numbered list (f. 3r, no. 9).
This preface (U1, f1r1–f2r4) , which comes immediately before the text, was written by the author himself. See details below.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF. 450 x 30 mm. Stringhole 35 mm from left edge.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not after 1845, since described in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue (1845).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 66, no. 469.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See f. 3r, no. 9.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 107r, 432 469.
